Subjective:
• 71 yo male
• Chief complaint: leg swelling
• Duration: 2 weeks, progressive
• Associated symptoms: shortness of breath with exertion
• Denies: chest pain, orthopnea

Objective:
• Vitals: 142/82, HR 88, RR 20, SpO2 92%
• General: Mild respiratory distress
• CV: S1S2, 2/6 systolic murmur
• Resp: Decreased breath sounds at bases
• Extremities: 3+ bilateral pitting edema to knees

Assessment:
The patient's presentation is consistent with decompensated heart failure. His symptoms of dyspnea and peripheral edema along with exam findings of elevated JVP, pulmonary crackles, and significant lower extremity edema support this diagnosis.

Plan:
Start aggressive diuresis with IV furosemide. Monitor daily weights and strict I/O. Obtain echocardiogram to assess cardiac function. Check BNP and renal function. Continue beta blocker and ACEI. Dietary sodium restriction counseling.
